availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alonzo L. Morton (Ohio Circuit Ct. Clerk)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Isaac Morton and Sarah H. Morton. Resident of Ohio County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twenty enslaved persons in Ohio County in 1850. Deputy Clerk of the Ohio Circuit Court in Ohio County in 1860. Household owned twenty enslaved persons in Ohio County in 1860. Clerk of the Ohio Circuit Court in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1, pp. 46A-46B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Hartford, pp. 156A-156B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Hartford, p. 505B.
"Alonzo L. Morton," The Hartford Herald (Hartford, KY), November 14, 1900, p. 3.
